Good relations with the dolphins are more important than a few fish. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/are/is} surprised to see the dolphins offering a few soggy herbs in return, and {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/accept/accepts} them with gratitude and grace.
p_l gives the dolphins a few of the patrol's fish and is surprised and grateful when {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/receive/receives} some useful herbs in return for the medicine cat den.

fail_outcomes.text: As p_l offers the dolphins some of the patrol's fish, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} accidentally {VERB/p_l/slip/slips} and {VERB/p_l/fall/falls} into the water. Both the patrol and the dolphins seem to be laughing at {PRONOUN/p_l/object}. The dolphins offer some herbs for the good laugh {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} gave them, but p_l just walks away, embarrassed and soaked.

intro_text: As the cats move along the shoreline, they spot something massive moving beneath the water.
decline_text: The cats are feeling remarkably incurious today.

success_outcomes.text: It's Nessie! The patrol trots up, exchanging a nice mouse for a nice deep-water fish, both creatures trading the respective delicacies that are hard for the other to obtain.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol is so wrapped up trying to work out what the creature is that r_c topples into the water. It solves the mystery though, as Nessie propels r_c back onto the shoreline with one gentle, immense flipper.

intro_text: As r_c skids down the sand dunes, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/spot/spots} a distant heap being washed ashore by the waves.
decline_text: Sniffing the heap, r_c decides that this is just too disgusting to be considered food.

success_outcomes.text: r_c sniffs the still-struggling prey - and jerks backwards when it crosses its Twoleg-like forefins. No, this isn't something {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} comfortable bringing back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c brings back the ocean's bounty to camp. A wonderful and easy catch!

history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by the poison in the Bishop-fish's flesh.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} poisoned by consuming Bishop-fish's flesh

intro_text: p_l waves r_c over with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail. What's that?!
decline_text: r_c isn't interested, and the patrol continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: The massive frog-Twoleg creeps up the rocks, slow and unnatural. The patrol watches, breathless, until it's out of sight. Well, p_l huffs. Maybe toads grow bigger than {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} thought. Terrifying.

fail_outcomes.text: Frozen, the cats watch the massive lumbering frog, the size of a Twoleg and just as bipedal. It halts and, like the rumble of thunder, issues a massive croak that creaks like cracking wood. All r_c can do is shiver.

intro_text: app1 spots a flat pancake of an animal, trapped in the tide pools, and flips it out from its sanctuary, mocking it as it flops gasping for water on the rocks.
decline_text: The stingray, much more capable of movement than app1 thought, flops back into the tide pool and out of reach.

success_outcomes.text: p_l waves a tail across app1's path, stopping {PRONOUN/app1/object} with a stern stare. Remember that the suffocating stingray still has its barbs. It's not a joking matter. app1 nods and apologizes. Every hunt deserves respect.

fail_outcomes.text: Confident of {PRONOUN/app1/poss} success, app1 pounces on the struggling stingray - only to feel a sharp, deep pain in {PRONOUN/app1/poss} side where the stingray's barb hits home.

history_text.scar: m_c was permanently marked by the barb of a stingray as an apprentice - but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} survived.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died from the strike of a stingray encountered on a hunt as a foolish apprentice.
